title.narrative: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Air and Radiation (OAR): PR-OAR-12-01026

description.narrative: The Global Methane Initiative (GMI) is an action-oriented initiative that will reduce global methane emissions by promoting cost-effective, near-term projects that recover and use methane as a clean energy source. GMI is international in focus and will expand collaboration between developed countries, developing countries and countries with economies in transition, together with strong participation from the private sector. Founding partner countries account for approximately 60 percent of global methane from the targeted sources.

person-name.narrative: Glen Cuscino and April Bullock; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Air and Radiation (OAR): The Clearing-House of the Partnership for Clean Fuels and Vehicles

description.narrative: This program includes Federal activities for the development, implementation, and evaluation of regulatory, market-based, and voluntary programs to reduce mobile source air pollution in developing countries through the promotion of clean transportation fuels and vehicles, as well as reduce vehicle travel.

description.narrative: Improve GHG Emissions Measurement in China: Interagency Acquisition Agreement with Department of State

person-name.narrative: Glen Cuscino and April Bullock; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Environmental Protection Agency, Environmental Programs and Management
Environmental Protection Agency, Environmental Programs and Management

title.narrative: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Air and Radiation (OAR): Requisition

description.narrative: These funds were used to sponsor a joint bilateral collaborative effort between the USA and China to develop an integrated decision support pilot system called Air Benefit and Control and Attainment assessment System (ABaCAS). As part of a continuing effort to build a bridge between scientists and policy makers, the ABaCAS will provide a user-friendly framework consisting of next-generation community modeling tools for conducting an integrated assessment of emissions control cost and their associated air quality and health benefits. This tool will enable decision makers and scientists in USA and China to use these next-generation assessment tools to conduct real time determinations of how emission changes will affect air quality using advanced modeling tools (RSM/CMAQ); estimate costs of control strategies (CoST tool); estimate and assign value to health benefits of control strategies (BenMAP); and evaluate strategies for attaining air quality standards (MATS). ABaCAS builds on initial efforts to apply advanced modeling tools to estimating in real-time the air quality impacts of emissions control strategies in the Yangtze River Delta (YRD) and elsewhere in the region.

person-name.narrative: Glen Cuscino and April Bullock; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Environmental Protection Agency, Environmental Programs and Management

description.narrative: These funds were used to sponsor a joint bilateral collaborative effort between the USA and China to develop an integrated decision support pilot system called Air Benefit and Control and Attainment assessment System (ABaCAS). As part of a continuing effort to build a bridge between scientists and policy makers, the ABaCAS will provide a user-friendly framework consisting of next-generation community modeling tools for conducting an integrated assessment of emissions control cost and their associated air quality and health benefits. This tool will enable decision makers and scientists in USA and China to use these next-generation assessment tools to conduct real time determinations of how emission changes will affect air quality using advanced modeling tools (RSM/CMAQ); estimate costs of control strategies (CoST tool); estimate and assign value to health benefits of control strategies (BenMAP); and evaluate strategies for attaining air quality standards (MATS). ABaCAS builds on initial efforts to apply advanced modeling tools to estimating in real-time the air quality impacts of emissions control strategies in the Yangtze River Delta (YRD) and elsewhere in the region.
